column4: just use a PDF reader.  I recommend using something like epdf or Okular or something open-source.. Adobe has horrible security issues.
whats the smallest to install?  I only have low monthly quota,. hence why I tried to avoid having to download 60MB of Adobe
open Synaptic and search for PDF readers
ok ty
will it let you download the PDF file?  Or does it force you to use your browser for viewing?
no, doesnt allow download of PDF
it only allows download in MS Money format file
It only allows to download statement in these formats: OFX, QIF and CSV
yeah then unfortunately you are going to have to install adobe reader.
any readers in ubuntu that can read OFX, QIF and CSV?
yes
what one? how I install it?
sudo apt-get install gnucash
what format does gnucash read? OFX, QIF or CSV?
you not sure it reads OFX, QIF and CSV?
I need to know for certain.. its 30MB of multiple files to be installed
it does both QIF and OFX
any other programs that can read OFX, QIF or CSV?  Because gnucash wants to install 50 files, about 30MB worth
try sudo apt-get install grisbi
its ok,  I download CSV and OO spreadsheet reads it
good deal
thanks :-)
